B1 under or below: The tunnel goes right underneath the city. They found a bomb underneath the car. Underneath that shy exterior, she's actually a very warm person. He was wearing a garish T-shirt underneath his shirt.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen the boat capsized we were trapped underneath it.The plaster on the walls has been removed to expose the original bricks underneath.You've got to appear calm in an interview even if you're terrified underneath.I put a bucket underneath to catch the drips of water.There's a spare set of keys underneath the flowerpot.
